name: Hampton Inn & Suites East Hartford

reviews.text: I recently attended a conference in Hartford and opted to stay across the bridge from "where the action" was. I AM SO GLAD I DID! The staff could not have been friendlier and the room was every bit as beautiful as the one a friend payed twice as much for. The breakfast options were excellent. As for proximity, it was an easy walk and readily accessible by vehicle. If I had had more time I would have made use of the swimming pool and gym as well. Clean, courteous and convenient! Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Outstanding service and value

reviews.text: I just recently stayed here over the weekend for a half business half leisure type deal. It was wonderful! I did NOT want to check out. Okay so the parking is free (plus), the lobby was very well decorated and warm/inviting, just like the front desk staff. I stayed in a guest room on the 5th floor with a King bed. Sooo nice. I don't know if they just recently remodeled or what but everything seemed brand new and sparkling clean. So there were three things that really made this hotel stand out from the rest for me.
reviews.title: Wonderful place stay here!
WOW! Great hotel, conveniently located for concerts at Comcast Theater.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and FREE wireless internet in my room!
reviews.title: Would happily stay again.
Great hotel, nothing wrong with location!
reviews.text: I read tripadvisor reviews before booking, and am glad I ignored the comment about "bad location." There's nothing wrong with this location! It's in an attractive industrial park, with a nice view of Hartford from the west side. Very nice hotel: clean, quiet, new.

The hotel is either new or very nicely kept. The staff was very friendly, rooms were very nice. The only qualm I have is with the location, it is borderline hood. The only decent restaurants are across the river..a short drive, but a bit of a hassle.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, borderline bad location

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and the staff were great. They did everything with a smile and were helpful with directions for dining. We stayed one night and enjoyed the pool and then the next day enjoyed the free breakfast before walking over to the CT Science Center with the little ones. This is mostly a business type hotel being in the area that it is in but we had a fine time and were very pleased with the hotel overall.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel with very friendly staff.

reviews.text: My husband and daughter stayed here during the first week of August. They just raved about the cleanliness, convenience and to be honest, the price, since this was a multi day stay. They were here for a 5 night stay because daughter was receiving treatment at Hartford Hospital. They found the hotel's neighborhood to be nice, (mostly office buildings) and it was about a 10-12 minute drive to Hartford Hospital. The room was very comfortable, daughter enjoyed the pool and the breakfasts were excellent! Our family would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it !
reviews.title: Great place to stay if you are coming to Hartford Hospital

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Hartford this past weekend and stayed at this hotel. Hint: type East Hartford into your GPS, not just Hartford. The king bed was fabulous, business travelers will find the desk and free wireless internet convenient, the tv swiveled so you could see it from any place in the room, the closet had 2 pants hangers and about 8 shirt hangers (incl. an iron), the bathroom had a shower that was quite large with glass doors and complete with hairdryer and coffee maker. We were on the 5th floor and had a pretty good stay. The second night there was a young child staying directly across the hall that woke us several times (from wee morning screaming: midnight, 1am, 2am). It was unfortunate. Not sure if the hotel can do much, other than possibly making several rooms with extra soundproofing to put children in. I have seen it indicated that they have a heated pool, and it might be, but I put one foot in and decided just to sit in a lounge chair. My husband was a bit braver, but said it was uncomfortably cool. There was no hot tub. We used the fitness center that was good by hotel standards and was all working: 2 treadmills, a stair stepper, a recline bike, and dumbbells. They had a water cooler, but it was not working. The breakfast area had plenty of room and was well stocked. They can close off the food area from the eating area, so they start closing at about 5 minutes to 10am, even on weekends. They also replace their cheese omelets with powdered scrambled eggs once they run out around 9:30am. For some reason the waffle machines leaked which created a big mess, but they still turned out well. The breakfast area did not have a good flow to it, but it might have just an oblivious individual that took entirely too long at the coffee station.
reviews.title: Show, Game, or Twain - Good Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to see a show at the XL Center. This hotel was just across the river, separated by a pedestrian/car bridge. We were unsure about parking in downtown, so we opted to take a cab to and from the show. It cost under $10 each way. The following day we spent the afternoon/evening in downtown, so we parked early for $10 for the day/evening (avoiding the higher event rates). This hotel was also an easy jaunt to the Mark Twain house. The tours fill up quickly, so advise getting there early (when they open) or you could end up waiting several hours to get into a tour.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: These downtown restaurants were worthy and served up delicious food: Agave Grill (Mexican) with their table-side guacamole and drink menu and Black-Eyed Sally's BBQ, and these bars ranked up there Pour House and Black Bear in the downtown area near the XL Center. Make sure to go early if you want to eat (2 hrs at least) before a game or a show because the places get packed. Before heading out, we enjoyed a nice lunch at El Sarape Restaurant (Authentic Mexican) away from the downtown and accessible by car, but we were advised not to go there after dark.
reviews.title: Definitely stay here!

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites East Hartford Hotel
description: Enjoy the brand new Homewood Suites by Hilton in Carle Place, NY. Big city location without the big city cost. Free parking,free wireless internet, 24 hr business center, 24 hr fitness center, indoor heated pool and jacuzzi. Don't forget to stock up snacks and travel essentials from our 24 hr Suite Shop. Start the day off with our complimentary Suite Start breakfast. Enjoy complimentary welcome home reception every Monday through Thursday. Only 17 miles from JFK and 18 from LGA our location is ideal for all your travel needs.
